case_vignette: a 61-year-old woman presents concerned about a white discoloration on her left breast that she first noticed 6 months earlier. it itches at times, and she is worried it might be cancerous. she showed it to her gynecologist at her annual visit, and he referred her to the dermatology clinic. physical examination of the left breast reveals a 10-cm white, smooth, porcelain-like plaque. there is no associated erythema and no noticeable scale.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I first noticed the discoloration and occasional itching 6 months ago.

No, there have been no changes in texture or size of the affected area.

No, I don't have a history of similar skin conditions or other skin diseases.

No, none of my family members have experienced similar skin issues or any other skin diseases.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you recently used any new skincare products?
No, I am not currently taking any medications or using new skincare products.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo
